Adult Enrollment Documentation Training

Presenter: Jonathan Dudzik

Janaury 2019 | Training Portal Home

Objectives

1. Identify enrollment documentation regulations and requirements

2. Identify a sample CACFP Adult Participant Enrollment Form

3. Accurately assess enrollment documentation

Janaury 2019 | Training Portal Home

Enrollment Documentation Requirements

  • Every enrolled participant must have enrollment documentation of file.
  • The records are valid the entire time the adult is enrolled.
  • Lack of CACFP enrollment documentation could lead to disallowance of reimbursement.

Janaury 2019 | Training Portal Home

Enrollment Documentation Requirements

Why must adult day care programs collect and maintain enrollment documentation?

Janaury 2019 | Training Portal Home

…It’s in the regulations.

Good
to
know!

Regulations in the CACFP:

What we mean when we refer to the "regulations" is the Code of Federal Regulations (CFR). The CFR is a codification of general and permanent rules published in the Federal Register by the departments and agencies of the Federal Government produced by the Office of the Federal Register and the Government Publishing Office.

Source: USDA: 7CFR Part 226

Enrollment Documentation Requirements

Regulation: 226.19a(b)(8)

Regulation: 226.19a(b)(10)

Click on each regulation below to take a closer look!

Janaury 2019 | Training Portal Home

7 CFR 226.19a(b)(8)

"Adult day care centers shall collect and maintain documentation of the enrollment of each adult participant including information used to determine eligibility for free and reduced price meals."

Source: USDA: 7CFR Part 226

7 CFR 226.19a(b)(10)

"Each adult day care center shall maintain records on the age of each enrolled person. In addition, each adult day care center shall maintain records which demonstrate that each enrolled person under the age of 60 meets the functional impairment eligibility requirements established under the definition of “functionally impaired adult” contained in this part. Finally, each adult day care center shall maintained records which document that qualified adult day care participants reside in their own homes (whether alone or with spouses, children or guardians) or in group living arrangements"

Source: USDA: 7CFR Part 226

Enrollment Documentation Requirements

Click on the “Need to know” button now to further define what Functionally Impaired Adult means.

Janaury 2019 | Training Portal Home

Need
to
know!

Definition: Functionally Impaired Adult

"Functionally impaired adult means chronically impaired disabled persons 18 years of age or older, including victims of Alzheimer's disease and related disorders with neurological and organic brain dysfunction, who are physically or mentally impaired to the extent that their capacity for independence and their ability to carry out activities of daily living is markedly limited. Activities of daily living include, but are not limited to, adaptive activities such as cleaning, shopping, cooking, taking public transportation, maintaining a residence, caring appropriately for one's grooming or hygiene, using telephones and directories, or using a post office. Marked limitations refer to the severity of impairment, and not the number of limited activities, and occur when the degree of limitation is such as to seriously interfere with the ability to function independently".

Source: USDA: 7CFR Part 226

Enrollment Documentation Requirements

Identifying the adult participant’s living arrangement is a requirement for CACFP.

Click on the “Need to know” button now to further define what a group living arrangement is.

Janaury 2019 | Training Portal Home

Need
to
know!

Definition: Group living arrangment

"Residential communities which may or may not be subsidized by federal, State, or local funds but which are private residences housing an individual or a group of individuals who are primarily responsible for their own care and who maintain a presence in the community but who may need on-site monitoring".

Source: USDA: 7CFR Part 226

Training Portal Home Enrollment Form

The Adult Enrollment form collects the required information in one simple form!

Click on the button with the paper clip located in the top right corner to download a copy of the form.

Let’s take a closer look at the Adult Participant enrollment form from the State agency

Janaury 2019 | Training Portal Home

Review an enrollment
form - Senario #1:

Click in the section that is missing information.

Correct! Joe’s enrollment documentation is missing the information on his living arrangement. This makes the documentation invalid. Joe’s meals cannot be claimed until the enrollment documentation is returned to the participant and completed.

That is not correct. Try again...

Review an enrollment
form - Senario #2:

Click in the section that is missing information.

Correct! Because John is under the age of 60, the enrollment documentation must indicate if he is a “functionally impaired adult.” This box needs to be checked for any adult day care participant under the age of 60. As in the previous example, John’s meals cannot be claimed until the enrollment documentation is returned to the participant or their guardian and completed.

That is not correct. Try again...

Enrollment Documentation Recording Keeping

All CACFP documents must be maintained on file for 3 years plus the current year.

But, keep adult enrollment documentation for all participants currently enrolled!

Janaury 2019 | Training Portal Home

Enrollment Documentation Best Practice

An enrollment policy would address these issues:

  • When the institution will collect enrollment documentation
  • Where the enrollment documentation will be kept
  • Who is responsible for verifying the enrollment documentation
  • How to ensure that enrollment records are kept confidential

Janaury 2019 | Training Portal Home

Enrollment Documentation Best Practice

  • Keep enrollment documentation organized in a binder at the center
  • Arrange enrollment documentation alphabetically
  • Document participant withdrawal date on the enrollment documentation
  • Before filing your monthly claim, ensure that all enrollment documentation is complete, including the date and signature
